intro: Selinum carniolicum, commonly known as the Carpathian wormwood, is a herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like parsley and dill, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Selinum carniolicum is noted for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
